title: Is the Big Ten the Best Volleyball Conference?
text:
College volleyball becomes more dominant each year. Many teams and conferences have proved their worth and contend to finish on top each season. Which team is the best though?
When you think of volleyball powerhouses, the Big Ten Conference may come to mind. Now while the Big Ten may have proven more dominant in recent years, when you look at history throughout the years, the Pac 12 actually holds the edge.


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(gt)
library(ggrepel)
library(waffle)

rpi <- read_csv("rpi.csv")
champions <- read_csv("champions.csv")

BlocksPerSet<- read_csv("BlocksPerSet.csv") %>% select(-Rank)
KillsPetSet <- read_csv("KillsPerSet.csv") %>% select(-Rank)

StatsLeaders <- BlocksPerSet %>% inner_join(KillsPetSet)

big <- rpi %>% 
  filter(CONFERENCE== "Big Ten")

ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=rpi, aes(x=reorder(CONFERENCE,-`Average Rank`), weight=`Average Rank`,), fill="light grey") +
  geom_bar(data=big, aes(x=reorder(CONFERENCE,-`Average Rank`), weight=`Average Rank`,), fill="blue") +
  coord_flip()+
labs(
    x="", 
    y="Average Rank", 
    title="Is the Big Ten the best volleyball conference?", 
    subtitle=" According to RPI, the Pac 12 is on Top, while the Big Ten is 2nd.", 
    caption="Source: NCAA | Sarah Person"
    ) +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot",
    axis.text.x = element_text(size=5) 
    ) 





Both conferences are closely ranked in RPI but the Pac12 holds a slight lead. RPI isn’t the only thing that comes into account when deciding the most powerful volleyball conference.
Championship titles are also a big factor. Both the Big Ten and Pac 12 have won multiple titles. Each of them have won more championships than five other conferences combined.


Code
big10 <- c( "Nebraska"=5, "Penn State"=7, "Wisconsin"=1,4)

pac12<- c("Washington"=1,"UCLA"=4,"Stanford"=9, "Southern California"=3)

other <- c("Pacific"=2,"Long Beach State"=3, "Kentucky"=1, "Hawaii"=3,"Texas"=1, 10)

iron(
waffle(big10,
         rows=2,
         colors=c("#E41C38", "#041E42", "#8C1515", "#FFFFFF")) +
labs(
     x="Big 10",
     title="Which volleyball conference is the most dominant?",
     subtitle="Each square is a title and the Pac 12 holds the edge.") +
   theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 10),
    axis.title.y = element_blank(),
   ),
  waffle(pac12,
         rows=2,
         colors=c("#4B2E83", "#2D68C4", "#8C1515", "#FFC72C"),
         ) +
labs(
     x="Pac-12",
     title=""),
  waffle(other,
         rows=2,
         colors=c("#E35205", "#FFC72A", "#0033A0", "#024731", "#BF5700","#FFFFFF"))+
  labs(
     x="West Coast, Big West, SEC, Mountain West, Big 12",
     title="",
     caption="Source: NCAA | Graphic by Sarah Person"
     )
  )





When thinking of the best of the best, one other thing may come to mind. Who ever has the best stats is the better team right?
Well, both the Pac 12 and the Big Ten come out on top in this category too.


Code
bigten<- c("Nebraska", "Penn St.", "Wisconsin", "Illinois", "Iowa", "Michigan", "Michigan St.", "Indiana", "Ohio St.", "Rutgers", "Maryland", "Purdue", "Northwestern", "Minnesota")

big<-StatsLeaders %>% filter(Team %in% bigten)

pac12<-c ("Oregon St.", "Stanford","Washington St.", "California", "Oregon", "Washington","Arizona St.", "Colorado", "Southern California", "Utah", "UCLA","Arizona")

pac<-StatsLeaders %>% filter(Team %in% pac12) 

topleaders<-c ("Maryland","Minnesota","Wisconsin","Nebraska","Stanford","Colorado", "Washington St.","Arizona")

topteams<-StatsLeaders %>% filter(Team %in% topleaders)

ggplot() + 
  geom_point(data=StatsLeaders, aes(x=KillsPerSet, y=`Per Set`),color="light grey")+
  geom_point(data=big, aes(x=KillsPerSet, y=`Per Set`),color="blue")+
  geom_point(data=pac, aes(x=KillsPerSet, y=`Per Set`),color="orange")+
  geom_text_repel(data=topteams, aes(x= KillsPerSet, y=`Per Set`, label=Team))+
  labs(
    x="Kills Per Set ", 
    y="Blocks Per Set", 
    title=" The Big Ten and Pac 12 led the nation in stats", 
    subtitle="Offensively and Defensively they both stood out among the rest." ,
    caption="Source: NCAA | Sarah Person"
    ) +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot",
    axis.text.x = element_text(size=5) 
    ) 





The Big Ten has been very dominant in the collegiate volleyball world over the past few years, but if you look at the overall success in the history of the sport, the Pac 12 actually holds the edge in rpi, championships, and stats.

title: About Sarah Person
text: I am a sophomore at the University of Nebraska Lincoln. I am majoring in sports media and communications and broadcasting. I have had a ton of experience here at UNL which include sports writing, broadcasting, photography and videography! My dream job is to become a play by player announcer for Nebraska volleyball on the radio or t.v.
